text: Johnny Costa (born John Costanza; January 18, 1922 â€“ October 11, 1996) was an American jazz pianist. Given the title "The White Art Tatum" by jazz legend Art Tatum, Costa is best known for his work as musical director of the children's television program Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. Costa died of aplastic anemia in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania on October 11, 1996, at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Deaths from anemia Category:American jazz musicians Category:American pianists Category:Musicians from Pittsburgh
